title: I write with my left hand, but I do everything else with my right, like throwing, cutting with scissors, holding tools, etc. Is this normal? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: “I write with my left hand, but I do everything else with my right, like throwing, cutting with scissors, holding tools, etc. Is this normal?” I’m about the same way. I write with the left hand. I use scissors with the right. I throw with my left hand. I hold a fork with my right hand, and my left hand cuts the meat without switching hands. I generally use a mouse with my right hand, though I can use my left just about as well. I pick up a drink with my right hand more often than my left. I kick a ball better with my right foot. I’m a mess. I suspect my speech area is on the left. (I’d love to know.). I suspect my brain’s language areas are strewn all over. All my life I’ve thought a bit differently than others, and I suspect this confusion contributes. None of that seems to have been a problem for me. Good luck discovering yourself.

Depends on your definition of “normal.” You sound a lot like me, so I'm inclined to think you're perfectly normal. I write with my left hand because my teachers insisted that I pick one hand for handwriting. I do most other things with my right hand, or equally with both hands. I think a lot of lefties are like this, because we grow up in a world made for right-handed people. It’s easier to just use your right hand than insist the world rearrange itself for your convenience.
